featured.text: While many of these poles can still be found in various locations on the west coast of North America, there is one pole that can now only be found in a museum—the shame pole.
Traditionally, shame poles were carved for a chief to embarrass and ridicule another who had done something wrong.

definition.en_def: A painful feeling of humiliation or distress caused by the consciousness of wrong or foolish behavior.
definition.example: She felt a deep sense of shame after realizing her mistake.
